definition[0]: the ability to feel relaxed or behave in a natural relaxed way
example[0]: He had a natural ease which made him very popular.
example[1]: The car handles these mountain roads with great ease.
example[2]: I was amazed by the apparent ease with which she got through the security system.
example[3]: Most modern laptops can store large amounts of data with comparative ease.
example[4]: It was a beautiful goal, scored with consummate ease.
definition[1]: if something unpleasant eases, or if you ease it, it gradually improves or becomes less
example[5]: measures to ease congestion in the city
example[7]: Heâ€™ll give you something to ease the pain.
example[8]: This should ease the burden on busy teachers.
definition[2]: to make a process happen more easily
example[9]: The agreement will ease the way for other countries to join the EU.
definition[3]: to move yourself or something slowly and carefully into another place or position
example[11]: Jean eased back on the pillows and relaxed.
example[12]: He eased himself into a chair.
example[13]: He eased his way through the crowd.
note[3]: ease your way past/through etc something
definition[4]: if limits, rules, restrictions etc are eased, or someone eases them, they become less strict
example[14]: India is easing rules for joint ventures with foreign concerns.
definition[5]: if interest rates ease, or if a government or central bank eases them, they fall slightly
example[15]: The central bank is prepared to ease interest rates further.
definition[6]: if prices on a financial market ease, they fall slightly
example[16]: Stock prices eased in a slow trading session.
example[17]: Shares in Tokyo Gas eased 2 to 565, and Marubeni lost 5 to 660.
